name: Supplementary data for 'Chapter 2: More than a trace of oxygen: Ichnological constraints on the formation of the giant Zn-Pb-Ag ± Ba deposits, Red Dog district, Alaska'
description: Supplementary file associated with PhD thesis Chapter 2 - More than a trace of oxygen: Ichnological constraints on the formation of the giant Zn-Pb-Ag ± Ba deposits, Red Dog district, Alaska. This includes six figures and one data table. Figure DR1: Regional geology of the Red Dog District. Figure DR2: Stratigraphic columns for the Kuna Formation. Figure DR3-DR4: Additional Red Dog traces. Figure DR5-DR6: Typical traces from non-hydrothermally altered sedimentary rocks compared with Red Dog traces. Table DR1: Sample locations. This file can also be found in the GSA Data Repository (item 2015292). It is available online at www.geosociety.org/pubs/ft2015.htm, or on request from editing@geosociety.org or Documents Secretary, GSA, P.O. Box 9140, Boulder, CO 80301, USA.

citation.text:
Reynolds, MA (2019) Genesis of sediment-hosted Zn-Pb-Ag mineralization in the Red Dog district, Alaska, USA. PhD Thesis, University of Alberta, Edmonton. https://doi.org/10.7939/r3-mmsk-9x89

Reynolds, MA, Gingras, MK, Gleeson, SA, & Stemler, JU (2015) More than a trace of oxygen: Ichnological constraints on the formation of the giant Zn-Pb-Ag±Ba deposits, Red Dog district, Alaska. Geology, 43(10), 867-870. https://doi.org/10.1130/G36954.1
